thread.title: Komets deal Alex Grieve, take on Cody Corbett and waive P.J. Fenton
thread.title_full: Komets deal Alex Grieve, take on Cody Corbett and waive P.J. Fenton

title: Komets deal Alex Grieve, take on Cody Corbett and waive P.J. Fenton
text:
Komets deal Alex Grieve, take on Cody Corbett and waive P.J. Fenton 
By Kayla Crandall -21Alive Komets deal Alex Grieve, take on Cody Corbett and waive P.J. Fenton October 13, 2015 Updated Oct 13, 2015 at 5:39 PM EDT 
Fort Wayne, Ind. (21Alive) -- The Komets announced Tuesday that defenseman Cody Corbett has been reassigned to Fort Wayne by their NHL affiliate Colorado, and placed forward P.J. Fenton on waivers. 
Corbett, 21, made his pro debut last season appearing in 47 AHL games with Lake Erie scoring three goals and six points. Corbett skated three years in the WHL with Edmonton and claimed the WHL championship his first season of juniors in 2011-12. In 2012-13 Corbett led Edmonton defensemen with 35 assists and 42 points while adding a +38. In 2013-14 the Lakeland, Minnesota native set new Edmonton team records for goals (17) and points (61) by a defenseman in a season. Corbett also set career point totals for a blueliner with 129 points in 190 games. Corbett capped the season with a spot on the memorial Cup All-Star Team. He also collected his second WHL league championship and was a co-winner of the Oil Kings Top Defenseman award. 
Digital Daily â€“ subscribe to our daily newsletter 
The Komets also announced Tuesday that they have dealt forward Alex Grieve to Alaska to complete a trade made earlier this summer for defenseman Justin Hamonic. Also, defenseman Austin Levi has been traded to Tulsa in exchange for future considerations. 
With today's transactions, the Fort Wayne roster has 24 players including 13 forwards, nine defensemen and two goaltenders.
